subject: Pedals not working
description_text: I just got my Newest Simsonn Pedal Pro X Ultra with Haptics and RGB Feedback pedals a couple of hours ago and they were missing the linear haptic feedback motors and brackets that were supposed to come with them. After still using them for a few minutes the throttle started to give less and less power when fully depressed, please supply a return address. Thank you!

conversations.body_text: Hi Connor Doolittle, Please open SIMSONN Manager and click the Offset button to re-zero/apply the offset. Since you adjusted the spring and mechanical setup, this step needs to be done again. If the issue still isn’t resolved, please record a short video showing the problem and share it with us via Google Drive, with the permission set to Anyone with the link can view.

Here is the video. I also never adjusted the spring and mechanical setup, I just attached the throttle to the baseplate and never messed with it. Here is the google drive link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c57ypRMEzKnbYEM95BItVaLF4f84Zq70/view?usp=drivesdk On Wed, Jan 14, 2026 at 6:07 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Connor Doolittle, I’ve reviewed your video. After you click Offset, you’ll need to run a full pedal calibration once: In SIMSONN Manager, click Calibrate; Press each pedal (Throttle/Brake/Clutch) with normal force; Click Save; After saving, test the pedals again — the blue progress bar should go smoothly from 0% to 100%. If it reaches 100%, the calibration is successful.
Yes that completely fixed the problem, sorry for all of the confusion and thank you for being so patient with me. On Wed, Jan 14, 2026 at 8:18 PM support@simsonn.com
